content: This thread is created solely such that we can discuss the new Africa Football League!!!Some details you should be aware of.You can also call it CAF AFRICAN SUPER LEAGUEThe African Football League comprises of 24 African clubsides, eight teams from three different regions - north, central-west and south-east Africa.The highest ranked clubsides in Africa were selectedOnly 8 clubsides willl commence the competition this year as the tournament kicks off in the quarter finals.Saudi Arabia is the African Football League major backer or sponsorWinners would get a sum up to $4m, the runners-up $3m, the semi-finalists $1.7m and the quarter-finalists $900,000The African Football League will be played for 10 months, with relegation and promotion taking place tooYou can watch the African Football League on AFL WEBSITE OR AFL YOUTUBE CHANNELMeet the teamsSimba SC (Tanzania)Al Ahly (Egypt)TP Mazembe (DR Congo) Esperance (Tunisia)Petro Atletico (Angola) Mamelodi Sundowns (South Africa)Enyimba (Nigeria) Wydad Casablanca (Morocco)Quarter finals first leg fixtures  Games will be played from 20-10-2023 to 25-10-2023Simba SC (Tanzania) vs Al Ahly (Egypt)TP Mazembe (DR Congo) vs Esperance (Tunisia)Petro Atletico (Angola) vs Mamelodi Sundowns (South Africa)Enyimba (Nigeria) vs Wydad Casablanca (Morocco)What do you make of the 2023 AFRICAN SUPER LEAGUE?Whats team are you supporting ?News Source: BBC and Goal sports platform.

comments.body: Quote from: cytpoway121 on November 25, 2023, 12:13:37 AMThis is the outcome of the Africa Football league, What opinions do you have about the tournament? Did it hit desired audience?This African competition only benefits a few countries and does not improve the domestic league in many countries. for example, South Africa, due to their good economic situation in relation to many other African countries, allows their teams to be able to sign good players, while teams from Egypt, Morocco, Nigeria are able to have good domestic players and do well in this competition and their internal league, thanks to their economic situation, which is superior to many countries. while in many countries people live in extreme poverty and high corruption, football is at a very low level to the point that local leagues have no quality and as a consequence when these teams arrive in African competitions, they are unable to perform well and are eliminated. earlyso with these countries that have these very corrupt governments and football is not evolving and the financial power of the people of these countries with corrupt governments, they are poor people, it is very difficult for African competitions to see many countries well represented in this competition, we will not see many fans in the stadiums when the games take place in many African countries. In my opinion, although this competition has good quality teams due to the fact that it has some well-developed African countries economically, it is still far from being compared with European and American competitions. African news channels don't give much coverage to this competition and the same happens for European and American news channels
